brainwave noun [C]
(BRAIN ACTIVITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a pattern of electrical activity in the brain: Non-rapid eye movement is a deep, quiet sleep marked by large, slow brainwaves. Researchers monitor brainwave activity before and after the sessions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe screen showed the flat-line brainwave of someone in a coma.Their research involved helping people with quadriplegia to use brainwaves to operate computer cursors.The scan showed that he exhibited abnormal brainwave patterns.

brainwave noun [C]
(IDEA)
UK informal (US brainstorm) a sudden clever idea: have a brainwave I couldn't see how I could get home from the station - then I had a brainwave. After a 4.30 a.m. brainwave he knew exactly what to do. This film was my brainwave.
